page.title: 12Attitudes/Newton area
page.content: Attitudes vary with age. People of middle age and over have usually lived in the area all their lives and have relatives and friends here. They do not go out much and regret the lack of old village life - doctor, butcher, baker. They feel life is not as good as it was. New people have usually chosen to live here and purchased their own houses. They tend to be young, most have children and have created facilities for them - playgroups and Youth Clubs. Children are children anywhere and happily attend the village school. They are more unsophisticated than the children from the cities and towns.
